title: vivo X200s details surface
description: vivo just launched the X200 back in October, and it's allegedly already working on the X200s due to arrive around April alongside the X200 Ultra. The X200s will be powered by MediaTek's upcoming Dimensity 9400+ SoC, a slight improvement compared to the Dimensity 9400 in the original X200. vivo X200 According to Chinese leaker Digital Chat Station, the X200s will have a 6.67-inch "1.5K" LTPS OLED display with extremely narrow bezels on three sides (we assume the bottom one will be ever so slightly thicker). excerpt: It will arrive in a few months. vivo just launched the X200 back in October, and it's allegedly already working on the X200s due to arrive around April...
text: vivo just launched the X200 back in October, and it's allegedly already working on the X200s due to arrive around April alongside the X200 Ultra. The X200s will be powered by MediaTek's upcoming Dimensity 9400+ SoC, a slight improvement compared to the Dimensity 9400 in the original X200. vivo X200According to Chinese leaker Digital Chat Station, the X200s will have a 6.67-inch "1.5K" LTPS OLED display with extremely narrow bezels on three sides (we assume the bottom one will be ever so slightly thicker). While the overall look of the camera island remains the same, the lens rim now has a very narrow design compared to what we've seen in the X200. The X200s is expected to sport three cameras on the rear, of which one will be a periscope telephoto, just like the X200. vivo X200 These are all the details currently leaked about the X200s, but surely more will be coming soon, so stay tuned. Source (in Chinese)
html:
vivo just launched the X200 back in October, and it's allegedly already working on the X200s due to arrive around April alongside the X200 Ultra.

The X200s will be powered by MediaTek's upcoming Dimensity 9400+ SoC, a slight improvement compared to the Dimensity 9400 in the original X200.

vivo X200

According to Chinese leaker Digital Chat Station, the X200s will have a 6.67-inch "1.5K" LTPS OLED display with extremely narrow bezels on three sides (we assume the bottom one will be ever so slightly thicker).

While the overall look of the camera island remains the same, the lens rim now has a very narrow design compared to what we've seen in the X200. The X200s is expected to sport three cameras on the rear, of which one will be a periscope telephoto, just like the X200.

vivo X200

These are all the details currently leaked about the X200s, but surely more will be coming soon, so stay tuned.

Source (in Chinese)
